sourceText: Apocryphon of John (Nag Hammadi II.1, c. 180 CE); Origen, Contra Celsum VI.24–38 (Ophite system, via Celsus c. 175 CE); Irenaeus, Against Heresies I.30; On the Origin of the World (NHC II.5); Pistis Sophia
note: Seven hostile planetary rulers — archons — through whose spheres the soul must ascend to return to the divine Pleroma. Unlike the Hermetic ascent (Corpus Hermeticum Poimandres) where the planetary zones are neutral and the soul simply sheds accumulated qualities, the Gnostic archons are active antagonists who imprison humanity in matter and ignorance. The ascending soul must know each archon's secret name and speak the correct formula to pass. Yaldabaoth (Saturn), the chief archon and false creator-god, declared 'I am God and there is no other beside me' — unknowing that the true God exists above him. Planet-archon assignments are most explicit in the Ophite system reported by Celsus/Origen. The Apocryphon of John gives different names and animal forms but does not explicitly assign planets; scholars reconstruct the mapping from listing order. Where sources disagree, both versions are noted.

Ialdabaoth.archon: Ialdabaoth (also: Yaldabaoth, Saklas 'the fool', Samael 'the blind god') — chief archon and Demiurge
Ialdabaoth.apocryphonName: Athoth (first of the seven in some Sethian readings; in others Ialdabaoth is the creator above the seven)
Ialdabaoth.archonticVice: False creation, spiritual blindness, the claim of sole divinity — 'I am a jealous God and there is no other god beside me' (ApJohn). The ultimate veil of forgetting.
Ialdabaoth.quality: Goodness (ApJohn — ironic: Ialdabaoth's 'goodness' is a debased imitation of true divine goodness)
Ialdabaoth.password: To Ialdabaoth: 'Thou ruler of the hidden mystery, Ialdabaoth... I have known thee and I have been freed from the power of thine archon. I have been anointed with white chrism from the tree of life.' (Ophite formula, Origen, Contra Celsum VI.31)
Ialdabaoth.description: Chief archon and Demiurge — the ignorant creator who fashioned the material world from the spark of Sophia's fallen light. Lion-faced in the Ophite system, reflecting ferocity and claim to kingship. Created the other six archons from his own substance. His declaration of sole divinity is the signature act of Gnostic cosmology: cosmic ignorance masquerading as supreme authority.

Iao.archon: Iao (variant of the Hebrew divine name YHWH — its reuse as an archon's name is deliberate Gnostic inversion)
Iao.archonticVice: Arrogance, false sovereignty — the archon who mimics divine kingship
Iao.password: To Iao: 'Thou, Iao, ruler of the hidden mystery, lord of the fifth aeon, I know thy name... I have been freed.' (Ophite formula)
Iao.description: The second archon bears a version of the supreme divine name, recast as a subordinate power. The seven-headed serpent combines threat and false wisdom. Donkey-face in the Apocryphon may connect to Set/Typhon — the ass-headed Egyptian chaos god. Jupiter's sphere: false kingship and corrupted law.

Astaphaeus.apocryphonName: Astraphaios (also in On the Origin of the World paired with 'Sophia Zoe')
Astaphaeus.archonticVice: Sorcery, avarice — desire perverted into possession, beauty twisted into entrapment
Astaphaeus.quality: Divinity (ApJohn — ironic: the 'divinity' this archon embodies is the false divine)
Astaphaeus.password: To Astaphaeus: 'Thou ruler of the third gate, Astaphaeus... let me pass, for I see the light of thy mother.' (Ophite formula)
Astaphaeus.description: Rules Venus's sphere — desire perverted into possession, beauty twisted into sorcery. Ass-face (Ophite) and hyena-face (ApJohn) suggest stubborn appetite and scavenging greed. In On the Origin of the World, appears in masculine-feminine pair with Sophia Zoe, reflecting Venus's dual nature.

Adonaios.archon: Adonaios (from Hebrew Adonai, 'my Lord' — another divine name captured as archontic)
Adonaios.apocryphonName: Yao (the ApJohn list has Yao at this position)
Adonaios.apocryphonForm: Seven-headed serpent (ApJohn — forms rotate between systems)
Adonaios.archonticVice: Lust, appetite — consuming hunger that devours spiritual aspiration
Adonaios.password: To Adonaios: 'Lord of the fourth gate, Adonaios, who has power over the sun... I know the seal.' (Ophite formula)
Adonaios.description: Rules the Sun's sphere — center of the archontic system, radiating false light. Name derives from Adonai, one of the most sacred Hebrew divine names, reframed as planetary prison-warden. Dragon form connects to Tiamat and the chaos-serpent. Lust here is not merely sexual but the consuming appetite of the ego for experience.

Horaios.archon: Horaios (also: Oraios; possibly from Hebrew 'Or' meaning 'light')
Horaios.apocryphonName: Sabaoth (at this position in some ApJohn versions; Sabaoth appears at different positions across texts)
Horaios.archonticVice: Deceit, false knowledge — cunning masquerading as wisdom
Horaios.password: To Horaios: 'Thou ruler Horaios... I bear the symbol of the tree of life.' (Ophite formula)
Horaios.description: Rules Mercury's sphere — language, writing, intellect perverted into deception. Eagle-face suggests sharp-eyed predation — the mind as hunter rather than servant of truth. Mercury's traditional messenger role becomes, in the archontic sphere, the messenger of lies. Gnosis passes through by wielding true knowledge against false.

Ailoaios.archon: Ailoaios (also: Elaios, Ailoaein; possibly from Hebrew El, 'God')
Ailoaios.archonticVice: Violence, wrath — force without purpose, destruction for its own sake
Ailoaios.quality: Jealousy (ApJohn — Zelos, consuming envy that drives conflict)
Ailoaios.password: To Ailoaios: 'Ruler of the second gate, Ailoaios... the mother is above thee.' (Ophite formula)
Ailoaios.description: Rules Mars's sphere — raw violence and competitive rage. Bear or dog face (Ophite) suggests bestial fury; ape face (ApJohn) suggests mimicry without understanding — violence as imitation of divine power. The ascending soul must pass through wrath without being consumed by it.

Sabaoth.archon: Sabaoth (from Hebrew Tzva'ot, 'of hosts' — as in 'Lord of Hosts')
Sabaoth.apocryphonName: Sabbede (or Sabbataios; the Sabbath connection sometimes links this archon to Saturn, but in the Ophite arrangement Sabaoth occupies the Moon)
Sabaoth.archonticVice: Jealousy, possessiveness — attachment to the material world as one's own creation
Sabaoth.quality: Understanding (ApJohn — Synesis, the lowest form of comprehension, bound to material perception)
Sabaoth.password: To Sabaoth: 'Sabaoth, ruler of the first gate, archon of the power of the first heaven... I am purified.' (Ophite formula)
Sabaoth.description: Occupies the Moon's sphere — boundary between archontic heavens and the material world. Bull face connects to lunar crescent and archaic lunar cult. Uniquely among the archons, in On the Origin of the World Sabaoth repents, recognizes the superior light of Pistis Sophia, and is elevated above the others to a throne in the seventh heaven. This redemption narrative is found for no other archon — Sabaoth alone turns.
